comments.value: If you search for the term 'publications' in the main site search, the publications page doesn't actually come up in the search results.  Any ideas on how to solve that?

Marna did we boost hub pages, maybe we need to tweak this so that they index page + title give a high boost.

Shout if you need my or K help on this, realise it's a balance.

I may propose we totally revisit the search to better deal with situations like this ie. we always show the most relevant index/hub page first / look at making the search a bit more faceted rather than purely free text. But for now if we can tweak it so that pub shows up top it will keep Liz and probably in turn the marketing / publications dept :)
We did boost index pages, but I have a feeling that the summary or body fields on them needed to be filled in for them to get included. I'll take a look now!

Liz, we're looking at tweaking the search term for you (going to see if we can boost index + title enough to push it up in the ranking - although this may result in index/hub pages appearing for other search terms when you don't want them, hopefully only in edge cases).

But I think it might make sense for us to look at totally revisiting the search in the new year and seeing if we can be a bit more clever with that page.

- breaking it down further by section
- pushing hub and key pages (we could label certain pages to push high in searches) to the top of the search, like a featured result in google
- tying up certain search terms to pages (ie. add a search keyword meta field which  allows a pages to be *really* highly boosted for that term)
- looking at using a more faceted search http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Faceted_search we already have a lot of meta data on each page, so we may not even need to run it though an engine to pull out the key terms, it may just be a case of using that data to allow users to drill down.
- allowing more filtering and see also style results.

Obviously there is a lot we *could* do, it may make sense to sit down in the new year, ideally with some google stats on what people search for  (I'll also try and did some out of the logs) and look at how we could improve users experience when using the search. 

Jamie

Cool -thanks Jamie. Does sound like the new year may be a good time for
new search functionality. Let me know how you get on with the tweaking,
though. It will make the publications people of the world v happy. :-)

comments.value: they've never worked in IE. but it'd be nice if they did.

They do now! I've made a couple of changes to the way that they work. 

You should be able to edit them and add new facts in IE, and also empty boxes will no longer display at all. 

What you see in edit view isn't what will appear on the page - it's not the 2/5 click-though format in edit mode, rather, it's in a long list. It should look right published or in preview, though. If the first fact's not filled in, nothing will display.

I've updated the sport, venue, generic content and generic hub templates. I think these are the only places that we have DYK boxes. Am I right? Let me know if I've missed one.
